definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: Or wait until the trouble to repair, often has a very serious problem.
sentences.chinese: 否则等到出毛病才送修，往往问题已经很严重。

sentences.english: The washing machine has gone phut.
Only three weeks after I bought my new car, problems started.
sentences.chinese: 我的新车买了才三星期就出毛病了。

sentences.english: I'm out of order. Peh , you're out of order. This whole courtroom's out of order.
sentences.chinese: 我是不正常，毕，你也不对劲，整个法庭都出毛病了。

sentences.english: My bike was so clumsily botched up that it broke down every hundred metres.
sentences.chinese: 我的自行车修得真糟糕，每骑一百米就要出毛病。

sentences.english: Is it the TV or the video camera?
sentences.chinese: 是电视机出毛病了还是摄影机有问题？
这台电视机又出毛病了。

sentences.english: You need to print out some documents, but the printer’s acting up again.
sentences.chinese: 你需要打印出一些文件，但是打印机又出毛病了。

sentences.english: Something is wrong with my watch. I'll have it repaired.
sentences.chinese: 我的手表出毛病了，我要让人修一下。

sentences.english: There is just so much that can go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 能出毛病的地方太多了。

sentences.english: I am so sick and tired of having trouble with that car.
sentences.chinese: 我心里很不舒服，而且讨厌那辆汽车出毛病。

sentences.english: We had no water to use.There was something wrong with the tap.
sentences.chinese: 没有水了，原来是水龙头出毛病了。

definition: to have sth go wrong/to have a problem arise/to give problems
to get sick because of bad food
erhua variant of 沒勁|没劲[mei2 jin4]
to choke/to stifle/to restrain/to hold back/to hold in (urine)/to hold (one's breath)
to fool around with/to mess with
